title.narrative: OP 2.3: JUVENIL JUSTICE

description.narrative: Parliamentarians and authorities of the juvenile justice system take actions towards strengthening alternative measures and reducing the deprivation of liberty of adolescents in conflict with the law., which contributes to Access To Justice, Justice For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 child protection system (legal framework, justice's system and institutions) strengthened to care, monitor and protect the rights of children affected by violence, abuse, exploitation and institutionalization, as well as children in conflict with the law.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Parliamentarians and authorities of the juvenile justice system take actions towards strengthening alternative measures andreducing the deprivation of liberty of adolescents in conflict with the law.

description.narrative: In 2020, actions were focused on advocacy to prevent a regressive legal reform that was part of the draft law for urgent consideration presented by the executive branch. UNICEF&39;s actions included meetings with leaders of all political parties (including the vice president of the Republic), technical documents sent to the entire Parliament and a presentation to the committee that drafted the final version. These actions prevented the adoption of regressive regulations that would have significantly increased sentences for adolescents who commit crimes such as theft, which are committed by 90 per cent of adolescents in conflict with the law. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:07/01/2021
